page.title: 07COAL MINING, KIRKCALDY
page.content: Seafield Colliery is situated on the outskirts of Kirkcaldy. Prior to the period of industrial action by the miners in 1984-85, Seafield produced approximately 17-18,000 tons of coal per week. The current weekly output is around 10,000 tons, partly due to the after affects of the strike, and partly due to an underground fire which did some considerable damage to one of the main faces. It is hoped that production will again be increased in the near future. Of the coal produced, 20% is used for household fuel, and the remainder is used in local industry (namely in Nairns floor coverings in Kirkcaldy, and in the paper mills in Leslie.) Coal is also shipped by rail and road to Longannet Power Station near Kincardine.
